text:
Hi everyone,
I'm trying to do some Black Magic with Hubl, I would like to create a global module with inside an Array, then insert the module in a custom coded template before other modules and then use the variable from the global module inside other modules (because the global content is loaded before other modules). Do you think is possible to do?
still curious if anyone knows an answer to this: <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/archives/C2YH119N2/p1532482308000124>

Here's the use case: I need to call an API from the browser using a foreign key I store in a Dropdown. The "Label" value of each option is human-readable, and the value is the foreign key. I'd like to render the *value* attached to the contact record in a page, so that I can use the value. Unfortunately when rendering these properties using HUBL eg `{ contact.MyDropdownProperty}` (outside of a form), it renders the label and not the value.

I understand why, but I'm curious if there's an alternate way to get the value saved in the contact property instead of the label, without resorting to rendering a form that contains both and querying the DOM for the currently selected option.

Separate question: *Personalization Tokens On Thank You Pages*
It seems like saving contact data to a HS contact is asynchronous from page rendering. If you try to render a Thank You page and want to use data from the form (e.g. "Thank you `{ contact.first_name }`" there's a high likelihood that HS has not yet processed the form, and the property will be empty.

In the past, I've used an "interstitial" page that uses `setTimeout` to wait before client-side redirecting to the Thank You page. But surely there's a better way. 

Any ideas?

<@U7QHZR9DZ> actually ran into this issue today with a client. Per this article (<https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/articles/kcs_article/cos-general/how-to-use-personalization-with-your-content>), if you are using personalization tokens on a thank you page, the values for these tokens will only populate for known contacts. If a new contact fills out a form and is redirected to a thank you page with a token, there isnâ€™t enough time for the data to process and populate the right information. If a default value is set, the new contact will see the default value on the thank you page.
for what it's worth, I'm using a module that looks like this:
which is gross, but it's the only thing I can think to do
